Touchscreen control module
Pairs with Android, iOS and Windows devices
Multiple camera modes:  single, burst, timed, random
Stores 8G locally; SD card slot for up to 32G additional storage
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capable
Two hours of video recording time with a single charge; 24 hours of photo capture
Automatic zoom 
Compact, foldable for ease of storage
Two microphones
Accommodates prescription lenses
Android, iOS, and Windows

How Does iPal Compare to Google Glass?


From imaging perspective, Google Glass is a head tracking camera. This camera has no idea of what your eyes are looking at, and pointing it properly is harder than pointing a smartphone with your hands. Only eye tracking cameras can follow your eyes. 




iPal Design Criteria
LOOKS MATTER:  If it's wearable, it has to look good and come in different shapes and styles. Wearables should not be big and bulky or make you look like a cyborg. iPal looks like a normal pair of glasses and won’t cause any distractions.
HEALTH MATTERS:  The further away a wireless unit is from your head, the lower your exposure to wireless radiation. The World Health Organization classifies wireless devices as Class-2B, meaning they may increase the risk of developing cancerous tumors in the brain.WEIGHT MATTERS:  Wearing a battery and processor on the face all day is cumbersome. Why carry the extra weight?
BATTERY LIFE MATTERS:  How useful is a wearable camera if it can only record 30 minutes with one charge? Placing the battery away from the frames allows for larger battery power and longer recording time. 
HANDS-FREE, AUTO-ZOOM MATTERS:  If a camera claims to follow, or track, your eyes, it must be able to zoom in and out too, and capture your peripheral view. 
iPal Is More Than A CameraiPal is much more than a camera. It is the next-generation intelligent personal assistant that goes beyond the current voice enabled assistants, such as Siri, Google Now and the upcoming Cortana, which are all "blind". iPal will offer a pair of eyes to Siri and all others. How Did iPal Get Its Name?
iPal is basically a wearable computer. It sees what your eyes see (input to your eyes) and what your eyes do in response (output), and it digitizes that information. Apps can use this information to let iPal become your videographer, shopping assistant or anticipate and fill other needs. If you're falling asleep at the wheel or are drowsy, iPal can detect that and alarm you before it's too late. When used with a facial identification app, iPal can remind you of forgotten names. When shopping, iPal can automatically recognize an object or read its bar code or QR code and bring up reviews or even let you know where else you can buy it for a lower price. These unique capabilities make iPal a true pal and an intelligent and trusted companion. Digital personal assistants such as Siri are blind. With iPal's help, Siri will be able to see soon.
Examples of iPal as an Intelligent Trusted Companion
 




A Bit About Us
i2i, Inc. 
We have an experienced team of engineers and advisers with extensive hardware, software and manufacturing experience. Our staff has developed and built highly sophisticated electronics and electro-optical systems for the imaging and telecommunication industries. Other team members and advisers have more than 70 years of combined operations, prototyping and manufacturing experience. One of our advisers started his own prototyping company. Another team member has over 20 years of hardware development including camera design. Another team member has over 10 years of industrial design experience. We are relying on many friends for the social media campaign. Key members of our marketing and social media team are listed at the bottom of this page.
 

 Our lab at local start-up incubator North Texas Enterprise Center (NTEC) 
To Wrap It Up...Current iPal Status 
We currently have a working lab prototype. With our prototype, we can take pictures or record videos, zoom in or out, or even turn on and off the camera with eye gestures. We can also crop a scene with eye gestures. The frame design has gone through three revisions.
What We Need, What You Get 
We began developing iPal in 2008. After considerable effort and dedication, we’re ready to reach the next phase and deliver the product to your hands. But funding this next phase is currently beyond our financial means. To show that we appreciate your support, we are offering pre-orders of iPal at significant discounts. The MSRP is $500, saving you up to $300 upon pre-order. To gain your trust, we will honor refund requests, as described below.
Production Plan and Risks
Dallas, Texas hosts some of the world's top tier Contract Manufacturers (CMs). There are also a number of quick turn-around prototyping facilities in the area that work directly with top manufacturers. iPal will be produced locally by one of these CMs so you can count on a timely, quality result. Prior to high-volume manufacturing, evaluation units will be built in Dallas by a local prototyping company.  
Risks can be grouped into two categories: technology and execution. Our functional prototype has already de-risked the technology portion. We have de-risked our supply chain by selecting off-the-shelf parts that are readily available and used in millions of smartphones. The image sensors and the processor that we use are already used in millions of smartphones, and contract manufacturers are familiar with them. 
Refund and Return
We will refund your purchase of iPal, if for any reason you change your mind before you receive your order. Contact us at support@meetipal.com with your request. After you receive your iPal, you will have 30 days to return the undamaged product to receive a refund.

story:
Update : Our first Media Coverage , check it out  - http://www.sbwire.com/press-releases/take-it-easy-app-could-help-prove-liability-after-auto-accidents-345350.htm

We all want a safer, more effective world

In today’s technological age, using pen and paper looks and feels primitive. The traditional exchange of information after a motor vehicle accident, a process we are all too familiar with, has become a serious burden. An accident is a stressful event that, for most of us, causes anxiety, fills our body with adrenaline, and makes us lose our focus. When we exchange information, we need to find the relevant documents and copy down lots of details, and sometimes, we need to do this in the dark, or in the rain. The stressful conditions of a motor vehicle accident make this an annoying, drawn-out process, which needs to be completed while we stand in the middle of a busy street. We are risking our lives every minute we are standing there.

The Take It Easy team has developed an ideal service featuring an application that does all of the work for you, in less than a minute. All you need to do is get yourself out of the accident area as quickly as possible.

Our team


Shay Gavriely – A private entrepreneur and third-year BA student with a wealth of experience in marketing, public relations, advertising, and product management

Haim Gavriely – An industrial and management engineer and product manager in a leading Israel company, with over 35 years of experience in the field and holds technical and administrative knowledge.

Neta Gavriely – Graduated with a BA in Economics, highly experienced in the stock market, and well-versed at project financing. She is currently completing her MBA, specializing in finance.

 Ronen Berkovich – An experienced application developer with over 17 years of programming experience. Ronen participated in the development of a number of applications that are now leading the global application market.


We are based in Tel Aviv, Israel, and we are currently meeting with Israeli insurance companies. Six out of the twelve companies that we have met with have already agreed to work with us. We are continuing this round of meetings in order to build a network of insurance companies working with the application, once we’ve received these companies’ final confirmation (we expect to conclude this round of meetings within 3-4 months). Naturally, we will update you, and you will be first to know once this occurs. We will then field the application in Israel, and immediately afterwards, once we have a working model (this gives us a very significant advantage, as it allows us to launch the application in other areas within a short time).  Next, we will begin working with the United States and with European and Asian countries simultaneously, if we have the financial capability to do so. This is where you come into the picture. 



What is "Take It Easy" ?

Motor vehicle accidents are stressful and unpleasant experiences, to put it lightly. After being involved in an accident, most of us become confused and tense. We are unsure of what we are supposed to do, what comes next, and most of all, which details we are supposed to obtain and exchange with others involved.

Take It Easy is an application designed to replace the traditional information exchanges that typically follow a motor vehicle accident. The currently accepted, yet unsafe procedure requires us to spend a great deal of time standing on the street, and we become frustrated when we find that we don’t know all of the details that we are supposed to obtain. We waste valuable time looking for relevant documents and trying to remember not to miss any important detail. If the accident happens at night, it will be much harder for us to jot down all of the details that we need from the documents that we’re given, after the other party to the accident has spent a great deal of time tracking down these documents. With Take It Easy, exchanging details takes less than a minute, allowing us to leave the scene of the accident as quickly as possible. It keeps us and the other drivers safer. 


How does it work?

The application is connected to a database of insurance companies that operate in the relevant country, and it therefore has information on all of the drivers in that country. If you get into an accident, all you need to do is open the application, which will ask you to input the license plate number of the other car that was involved in the accident. Then, the application sends an SMS to the owner of that vehicle, which includes a code that you will have to enter to get access to that driver’s personal information. After this information is entered into the system, any relevant information will be sent to the email that you registered with when completing the application’s initial registration. The same information will be simultaneously sent to your insurance company. The next time you check your email, you’ll find a PDF file with all of the information you need, organized according to the insurance office standards of your country of residence, including pictures and video clips of the accident that can be added with the click of a button. Your insurance agent will receive a copy of this report in his inbox or in a fax, in real time. The entire procedure takes less than a minute, so that you and the other driver that was involved in the accident can get off the road almost immediately, while receiving all of the information you need in the most effective, organized, and appropriate way. Once the license plate number has been entered into the system, the application will automatically contact the towing service used by your insurance company to tow the vehicle away from the scene of the accident, if necessary. The more traditional and cumbersome way to exchange information may become drawn out and problematic when it’s dark outside, when it’s raining, or when it’s particularly hot, but Take It Easy is unaffected by time, date, or weather conditions; whatever the road or weather conditions, it simply gets the job done.

With Take It Easy, you’re working quicker, more effectively, and most of all- safer.


So what’s inside?

  •  Geo-location: The application uses your mobile device’s built-in geo-location capability to locate itself, so that it can email the user a report that includes the location, the date and the exact time of the accident, along with a map of the area. This way, if you’re unsure of your exact location, the application will be able to locate you and specify your location in the accident report that will be emailed to you and your insurance company.
  •   Automatic towing service – Once the application recognizes that it has been used (that is, when a license plate number has been entered), it updates the towing service used by your insurance company. The towing company will then contact you immediately, to determine if you need towing service. You don’t need to figure out how to solve the situation, or look for help – Take It Easy will do it all for you.  
  •  Simultaneous notification – Once you have entered the details (i.e. the name and license plate number) of one of the drivers involved in the accident, the other party to the accident – that is, the driver whose name and license plate number were entered into the system – will also receive the exact details of the accident in a report sent to his or her email address, which will include the accident location and photographs of the accident (if any photos were attached). At the same time, this information will immediately be sent to both parties’ insurance agents! An SMS message confirming that the details were received and forwarded will be sent to the mobile phones of both drivers. 
  •  Adding photos or video clips in real time – Before sending the information, the application gives you the option of including photographs and video clips of the accident, that document what had occurred several minutes earlier. You can even interview eye-witnesses that were present at the scene. All of these files will be attached to the accident report, which is sent to your email address and your insurance agent’s email address in real time (up to 50 MB of data can be attached).
  • In development!  We are considering a future add-on to the application in the form of a capability to take real-time photographs of the accident as it occurs. This feature will employ a sensor that will identify the moment of impact and automatically activate a micro-camera with a 360º radius (“fish-eye”). The photograph will be sent to the application over Bluetooth, and will be attached to the accident report. This camera can also be used with the application to document any collisions with a parked vehicle while the vehicle’s driver is not present. We’ll use the money to assess the option to incorporate these services into the application. 



                                             



The application is designed to take care of everything that needs to be done by a driver after being involved in an accident – even arranging towing service, if needed. Therefore, even if a driver is not well-versed with the process that should be carried out after an accident, this process can be completed, in less than a minute, instead of going through the traditional and rather irritating information exchange process, which is longer and less safe. The application allows drivers to leave the scene of the accident as quickly as possible; meanwhile, the application will have dealt with this lengthy and irritating process in the quickest and most accurate way possible – without making mistakes. The application will be available as a free download off of the relevant application store, but in order to activate the program, the user will need to enter a code, on a one-time basis, which will be provided by the user’s insurance company after the user renews his or her insurance policy. 






                                                 


What We Need ?

During the first phase of fundraising, we intend to raise $200,000 which will be used for the following

  •  Completing the development of the application – currently, a prototype exists, along with sketches. We’ll use the funds that we raise to pay the developer that works with us to complete the development of the application for the Android and iPhone platforms. This development will include building a database, which will be stored on a server. This database will be a sample database that will include the details of 100 sample drivers, used to demonstrate the application to insurance companies. We want to create an appropriately-designed user-friendly customer interface that will include all of the features described above.
  • We are considering including an add-on to the application that will take a photograph of spot of impact in real time. We’ll use the money to develop a micro-camera adapted for use with the vehicle, which will enable users to add a photograph or a short video clip taken of the accident as it occurs. This data will be sent to their smartphones via Bluetooth.
  • After running the application in the State of Israel, where we are operating, we will use Indiegogo or other VC funds to raise an additional sum, which will be used to finance travel to Europe, Asia and the United States, where we have amassed business contacts. While in Europe, Asia and the United States, we will meet with the heads of insurance companies and offer them the application, which we intend on introducing into the American, European and Asian markets.


Questions? Comments? Suggestions?


Email Shay : shaigav@gmail.com



Roadmap


1.  October-November 2013: Indiegogo campaign, meetings with remaining insurance companies

2.  December 2013: Last meetings with insurance companies, beginning the application’s final stage of development, beginning work on integrating a micro-camera into the application

3.  January-March 2014:

-  Completing the development of the camera, and conducting trials to integrate the camera into the application. The application will be fully functional in the State of Israel.

-  Beginning meetings with insurance company heads all over Europe, Asia, and the United States.

4.   March 2016: The application will be available for download throughout Europe, Asia and the United States, and will be supported by insurance companies active in each country.



check our perk program , you will find very pleasant surprises.



*note that every contributor will get cradit and will see his name in our "people who made it happen" list .

story:
Coming to a desk near you.


New. Refreshing. Tidy. Compact. That's the C1 Computer Case, and that's what we want to bring to your desk. A case that doesn't compromise on hardware compatibility, yet saves you space in an age where desk space is a premium.


Our product is currently in the prototype phase. This IndieGoGo campaign aims to raise the funds needed to produce prototypes for testing purposes, as well as to send to hardware reviewers. When it finishes, we will be following it up with a campaign to do a production run of an estimated 1,000+ cases.




We're shaking up the computer case industry with our useful features for gamers, hardware enthusiasts and industry professionals:

  1. A short VGA, HDMI and branching power cable come with the case for reduced cable clutter. Less mess, less stress.

  2. Rotated motherboard points the IO ports downwards for tidier cables. The motherboard is also raised up into the case to allow cables to go beneath it.

  3. Carry handle makes transporting the case easy, from desk to desk or room to room.

  4. The case has a very small footprint, leaving you with a much more pleasing work area, for all that important stuff you do.

  5. The case has space for GPU's up to 10.5", as well as:
    •  mATX or ITX motherboard
    • ATX PSU
    • Two 3.5? drives
    • Two 2.5? drives
    • GPU’s up to 10.5?
    • Low profile CPU coolers
    • Four 120mm fans
    • Water Cooling: 1X 120mm cooler and 1X 240mm cooler can be used, at the same time. Water coolers will not fit if an mATX motherboard is used.







    6. Price Breakdown:

  • Production of four prototype cases: $2,000

That's the bare minimum for what we need to keep Crono Labs moving forward, but we're hoping to beat that goal, in order to have funds for:

  • Marketing
  • Further iterations to the final design.

    When you back our project, your contributions will be used to carry out the above. If we go past our goal, the surplus will also be used accordingly; we will be able to produce more prototypes to have reviewed, and you will enable us to run a larger marketing campaign.







Q: What monitors can I mount onto the case?
A: You can mount any monitor with a VESA mount to the case. Monitors over size 27" might be an issue in terms of stability.

Q: What are the dimensions of the case?
A: The case is 446mm X 270MM X 122mm (L x H x W)

Q: How much will the finished product cost?
A: We aim to sell our product for $150.

Q: How can I get the finished product?
A: Our finished product will be available to back on Kickstarter at the end of 2015. People who select the Discount Reward will receive a discount on the finished product.



    Crono Labs is composed of two Irish youths, Oliver Burke (17) and Ruairi McNicholas (18). We both have a vested interest in technology and began using computers at a young age. IT is our passion, and our love of hardware began when we built our own computers.

    Our story begins with F1 in Schools, the worlds largest technology challenge for students. It challenges teams of 3-6 to design, build and race a miniature Formula 1 car. Of 20,000 teams around the world, we were one of 39 to reach the World Finals in Abu Dhabi.

    We intend to replicate this success with Crono Labs. We have the skills and experience needed to create a truly useful and unique product. But like the F1 challenge, we rely on peoples goodwill and interest in our product to get it off the ground.


    We welcome comments, feedback and questions, and look forward to hearing back from people who are interested in our campaign.











    Web Summit is a technology-industry conference held in Dublin, Ireland, and is considered to be one of the best tech conferences in the world, boasting past speakers such as Elon Musk. Every year, start-ups can apply to attend, and are given a booth at the event if they are chosen to participate.

    We're delighted to say that we will be attending Web Summit 2015 as a start-up company! We will be showcasing the C1 Case for a day, and spending the other two submerging ourselves in the Summits rich variety of speakers and exhibitions.

    Closer to November, we'll update you with our booth location and time; pop down and visit us, we'll have a warm welcome for any of our backers we meet there!
story_txt:
Coming to a desk near you.New. Refreshing. Tidy. Compact. That's the C1 Computer Case, and that's what we want to bring to your desk. A case that doesn't compromise on hardware compatibility, yet saves you space in an age where desk space is a premium. Our product is currently in the prototype phase. This IndieGoGo campaign aims to raise the funds needed to produce prototypes for testing purposes, as well as to send to hardware reviewers. When it finishes, we will be following it up with a campaign to do a production run of an estimated 1,000+ cases.We're shaking up the computer case industry with our useful features for gamers, hardware enthusiasts and industry professionals:
A short VGA, HDMI and branching power cable come with the case for reduced cable clutter. Less mess, less stress.


Rotated motherboard points the IO ports downwards for tidier cables. The motherboard is also raised up into the case to allow cables to go beneath it.


Carry handle makes transporting the case easy, from desk to desk or room to room.

The case has a very small footprint, leaving you with a much more pleasing work area, for all that important stuff you do.

The case has space for GPU's up to 10.5", as well as:
 mATX or ITX motherboard
ATX PSU
Two 3.5? drives
Two 2.5? drives
GPU’s up to 10.5?
Low profile CPU coolers
Four 120mm fans

Water Cooling: 1X 120mm cooler and 1X 240mm cooler can be used, at the same time. Water coolers will not fit if an mATX motherboard is used.











Price Breakdown:

Production of
four prototype cases: $2,000

That's the bare minimum for what we need to keep Crono Labs moving forward, but we're hoping to beat that goal, in order to have funds for:
Marketing
Further iterations to the final design.


When you back our
project, your contributions will be used to carry out the above. If we go past
our goal, the surplus will also be used accordingly; we will be able to produce
more prototypes to have reviewed, and you will enable us to run a larger
marketing campaign.




Q: What monitors can I mount onto the case?A: You can mount any monitor with a VESA mount to the case. Monitors over size 27" might be an issue in terms of stability.Q: What are the dimensions of the case?A: The case is 446mm X 270MM X 122mm (L x H x W)Q: How much will the finished product cost?A: We aim to sell our product for $150.Q: How can I get the finished product?A: Our finished product will be available to back on Kickstarter at the end of 2015. People who select the Discount Reward will receive a discount on the finished product.




Crono Labs
is composed of two Irish youths, Oliver Burke (17) and Ruairi McNicholas (18). We both have a vested interest in
technology and began using computers at a young age. IT is our passion, and our
love of hardware began when we built our own computers.

Our story begins
with F1 in Schools, the worlds largest technology challenge for students. It
challenges teams of 3-6 to design, build and race a miniature Formula 1 car. Of
20,000 teams around the world, we were one of 39 to reach the World Finals in
Abu Dhabi.
We intend to
replicate this success with Crono Labs. We have the skills and experience
needed to create a truly useful and unique product. But like the F1 challenge,
we rely on peoples goodwill and interest in our product to get it off the
ground. 

We welcome comments, feedback and questions, and look forward to hearing back from people who are interested in our campaign.























 Web Summit is a technology-industry conference held in Dublin, Ireland, and is considered to be one of the best tech conferences in the world, boasting past speakers such as Elon Musk. Every year, start-ups can apply to attend, and are given a booth at the event if they are chosen to participate. 
We're delighted to say that we will be attending Web Summit 2015 as a start-up company! We will be showcasing the C1 Case for a day, and spending the other two submerging ourselves in the Summits rich variety of speakers and exhibitions.


Closer to November, we'll update you with our booth location and time; pop down and visit us, we'll have a warm welcome for any of our backers we meet there!

story:
- PRESS -

"A single man effort...using technology to solve actual problems faced by us"


"Delhi Engineer Wants to Make Wireless Chargers Actually Usable"



Qitah. Go Unchained!

If you thought wireless chargers were no good, you were right! If all they do is save you from connectors, keep your pockets locked.


It's not that we hate plugging in, it's that we hate the whole concept of having a battery that needs attention everyday! Qitah wireless charger is designed to be a natural home for your phone, it just happens to charge the phone while resting. Place your phone on the Qitah at any skewed angle/portrait/landscape orientation - and always have one hand free!

You'll never even realize you have a charger. It's freedom at last!

FAQs

Ok. What's a wireless charger anyway?

Ah! When your phone charges without plugging in a cable, it's called wireless charging. You just need to place the phone on the charger's surface and it charges through magnetic induction - no connectors!

Will it work with my phone?

Qitah is a wireless charger based on the Qi standard. It will work with any Qi compatible device like the Nokia Lumia 920, Nexus4, Samsung S4 (with Qi cover or QiCard), HTC Droid DNA, Nexus7(2013) or any device that can be made Qi compatible like the Samsung S4, S3, Note2 and the Lumia820.

So it's not like WiFi?

Nope, wifi works over distance. Qi wireless charging is proximity based. WiFi like wireless power is still a distant dream.

Fine, but there are other wireless chargers out there..

Absolutely, and:

a) Most have a single coil, which means you gotta align your phone to get juice, isn't that as bad as plugging in?

b) Their plastic surface would scratch the phones' back!

c) If they're flat, you don't get to see or interact with your phone 

d) Inclined ones are bulky and so you'll still be wired on    vacation..WIRED..ON..VACATION!! AAARRGGGG!!

So the Qitah is different..How?

A three coil system and a cool 40 degree incline combined with a soft SmartGrip to hold your phone in Portrait/Landscape and my favorite - skewed angles - gives you the freedom to carelessly place your phone on the Qitah, without having it scratched! 

That means you don't even have to move your eyes from your Laptop/Mac/PC to get your phone to juice up! And you check out notifications/texts etc. without lifting your phone, one handed!  It's such a natural home for your phone, you'll never have to remember to charge!

Qitah is as slim and light as your phone and will collapse to a minimal and sensible 7 degrees to give you peace at night, and on vacation :)

Oh, and it's built on Qi version 1.1 technology, that's the latest and best out there, you won't find this in most other wireless chargers!

Sounds cool..but is it faster than my wired charger?

Qitah delivers 5Watts  of power (as mandated by the Qi standard). So it's faster/same as most wired chargers and slower than some. 

But when you have a Qitah on your desk, you won't be bothered. Qitah is a natural home for your phone, and just happens to juice it up while you're busy with other stuff.

I'm in :) How do I choose my Qitah's color and/or my QiCase/QiCard?

We'll send out a survey sometime after the campaign to ask for your choices. Qitah comes in Shadow Black and Feather White


Will the Qitah work even if I use a case on my phone?

Yes! Inductive charging works through all non-magnetic materials. So all plastic/rubber/silicone and other non-magnetic cases are not a problem.

For iPhone owners that use a case: You'll need to replace your case with the QiCase.

Why is there a separate perk for my N4?

N4's are not fully Qi compatible which is why they have issues with Qi chargers (This is our understanding, we've had no discussions on this with the N4 manufacturers, so we might be wrong, although it's highly unlikely).

We've come up with a special solution for N4s which will ensure smooth functioning (No cycling issues)

Are there risks to this project?

Absolutely! Like all entreupreneurial endeavours, the path to success for projectQitah will be filled with trials and travails that might delay/end the project. 

But if our goal is hit, they reduce to a minimum. We've got our vendors aligned for all the components and that gives us good confidence of delivering on the perks.

Whatever the case may be, I'll pull out all me horses to try and fulfill the perks on time.

 

The How And When Of Qitah!


Who's Me?

I'm Tapan, an Electrical Engineer from New Delhi, India. My passion for technology was rotting alone until I discovered a love for design. They both came together in projectQitah.

I Got By With a Lil Help From My Friends

While conceptualizing the Qitah, invaluable insights from friends and strangers revealed that plugging in was a minor pain point.

A bigger problem discovered was the need to remember to charge!  

Portrait and Lansdcape positioning are so 2012! I wanted my phone to work with the Qitah even in a skewed position..and it does now :) 

With that, I can blindly place my phone, making the Qitah a natural home for it!

When we worked with Paul Studio, a two time RedDot awardee, the focus was creating a clean and beautiful design that could make your desk proud. They designed for delight hidden in minimalism. The Qitah was ready for the big test.. Your vote!

We need to reach our goal in order to

a) Get a high quality injection molding tool made - About $25K

b) Get the necessary certifications - Another $15K

c) Manufacture the Qitah - $40K

Your contributions will help the Qitah get off the ground, and that would mean the world to young startups like mine who believe that great things are possible if only great value is imagined.

You'll stay in our hearts..we'll etch your name on our workshop wall in a cool Grafitti made by Delhi's young and promising Grafitti artists. Grafitti is new to India, and the artists focus on responsibly keeping Delhi happy and aware through their work.

Let's Get FamoUs! 

You can help even if you don't choose a perk :

a) Use the IndieGoGo share tools right below the video

b) Like us on facebook

c) Share this window's url on your facebook timeline

d) Tell your friends

e) Follow us on Twitter

For every contribution made, $1 goes to the WikiMediaFoundation (which runs Wikipedia)

(Disclaimer: I know no-one who is or has been a part of WMF, nor do I have any interest in it. Donations to WMF will be made purely for personal gratitude towards Wikipedia)

story:
Short Summary

My Name is Brock Rice and I am a 30 Year old Entreprenuer.  I've completed 7 deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan while serving 10 years as a Combat Controller in the United States Airforce.  I am currently studying business in University and have created a product that will eliminate "power source" worries of smartphone users around the globe.

My Campaign is about the production of disposable batteries that are specifically desgined to charge the Iphone, Ipad or Other smartphone devices that regularly run out of power at the most critical moments.  I can relate to the frustration of leaving a charger a home and having to make the choice of going without my device or purchasing a new pricey charging cable which ultimately ends up being the more costly of the two.  

My campaign strives to develop and produce disposable batteries that will be readily available at gas stations, Convenience stores and Airports around the world.  No more worrying when the device reaches the critical 10% battery warning with no charging ability near by.  A quick trip to the nearest store will provide a much needed charge while staying mobile.  No more carrying bulking items that will take up room in your purse or pocket.  a Quick Charge from one of these batteries will allow you to continue using your device as well as keep you on the move.

Contributers will help me finish the Research and developent of the product and take it from the design stage to the production stage.  I have a patent on the idea and have began preliminary resarch as to what is required, however I require additional funding in order to make the leap to the next level.

What We Need & What You Get

Research:

I am asking for $35,000 in order to complete the research and run an initial production of 1000-2000 units.

It is estimated between $10,000 to $15,000 for electrical circuit design that will meet specific charging criteria for smartphone devices as well as working prototype.

Tooling and initial production will cost between $15,000 and $20,000 and will be used to produce between 1000 and 2000 units for a segmented market to build credibility.

From there I plan to increase production and distribute the product domestically and internationally.

Perks will include free batteries for your smartphone device!!

If I do not reach my funding goal, I will use what funds are available to persue Research and the development of 3D Production Ready Cad Drawings that can be used to apply for a non-provisional patent.  From there I will negotiate for liscencing deals.

 

The Impact

My Campaign will eliminate all worries that smart device users have when they leave their charger at home, or get stuck in the airport with no charging terminal.  The battery will be readily available for purchase at many convenient locations and will eliminate the need to stay glued to a wall or carry bulky items.

 

Thank you for looking at my campaign!!

Feel free to look at my webpage:

http://www.ideasupport.net/view/zku6wvh5450ix1ku/

story:
So we've gotten a lot of feedback that the video and a lot of this information is confusing. If it is please use the quick summary! We'll make a better and easier video to understand soon!

FAQ At Bottom! Seriously, if you're skeptical, read it! We really thought everything through. Ask us anything!

EDIT FROM VIDEO: We will not be using Dubloons, we will add money to your account daily based on total bandwidth used, average daily GB stored for a month and a reliability and availability coefficient. Thanks for the suggestion!

QUICK SUMMARY FOR YOU TL;DRs

Almost all technology companies need bandwidth and servers. They need the servers to do computing and store data, and the bandwidth to bring that data to you. For example, Facebook uses servers to store your photos and videos, and uses the bandwidth to send those photos and videos to your computer. Piratebase makes use of your wasted computing power (old electronics) and wasted bandwidth to power our very own cloud database. It's very much like converting your computer into a torrent seeder, but it's more secure, efficient, and makes you money! That means Facebook could instead of buying servers, use thousands of your computers to power itself. You get free money for no work, software developers get access to cheap(est), reliable, and powerful cloud services  and hopefully PirateBase will convince people to keep their electronics or repair them so they can make money off of them!

So first things first, how much can you make?

Well lets do some calculations!

Let's say X is the number of hours you don't use the internet per day.

Let's say Y is the number of gigabytes of hard drive you haven't used.

Lets say Z is your internet upload speed in mbps.

These are very conservative estimates.

If you got paid .06 cents for every Gigabyte our software uploaded for you (half the price of Google Cloud Storage),

and you got paid $.01 a month for every Gigabyte of files from our clients stored in your drives (matches the cheapest storage provider).

You would get paid around 

((Z/8000) * 60 * 60 * 30 * X * .06)(.50) (efficiency coefficient - conservative estimate) + (Y * .01) * Z/24 per month!

So if you didn't want to do any math, assuming you have 5 mbps upload speed and 1 TB of free hard drive space, and spent 1 hours using the internet uploading things (most people download when they're browsing the internet).

You would earn $47 each month from uploading, and $10 each month from storing files in your extra storage space! All for downloading some software!

Now let's say you had 20 mbps upload speed, you would earn

$187 a month from uploading!

Your best situation would be if you had a many machines machine connected to your internet for a total of 16 GB RAM and 1 gbps internet speed (this is for you google fiberians!). You would earn a whopping 

$9350

That's right. Close to 10 grand for making use of your unused bandwidth! And remember, this is all while powering the the most affordable cloud service, while putting in no effort!

Don't you think that PirateBase might drive up demand for faster internet? That's awesome because everyone hates slow internet.

These numbers may not be completely accurate (but they are really conservative) due to down times in your ISP's, down times in our system, and not enough demand for PirateBase :(.

Now, If you're interested read on!

The Internet is the single largest and most important development in human history, past, present, and future, but large internet corporations and the government are taking away your rights and privacy. PirateBase wants to give the power of the Internet to the users. Software developers, this is the solution you've been waiting for: a cheap, scalable, and simple key-file datastore solution so you can concentrate on what you do best, making great web software.

Who are we?

We are creative, talented programmers located in Dallas with a passion for networks. We are trying to raise funds to fully devote our time to building the world's first decentralized key-file cloud database for software developers.

What is it?

For Developers

PirateBase is a decentralized, patent-pending, secure key-file database with a simple API. It will be much cheaper than cloud storage options on the market right now especially for highly requested files, and will offer low latency, 99.99% availability, and unlimited throughput. Developers need not worry about their data being lost because the data will be securely replicated on multiple machines across the US (and other countries later on). It will offer the scalability of large databases managed by Google, Facebook and other tech giants without any initial capital cost. Secure encryption will ensure that not even PirateBase will have access to the information stored in the database.

Cloud storage and networking specialists, wanna help? Contact us on the FAQ, we would love to hear your input and expertise.

For Gamers and Techies and Computer Users

Rent out your unused computer storage and bandwidth for our crypto-currency, in which you can then sell for cash! All you have to do is install our software, and watch your account balance grow! PirateBase will have the lowest bandwidth and processor priority, so it won't interfere with your work or play. You can use PirateBase to store your files. Our services are fast, secure, reliable, and most of all affordable. 

PirateBase Dubloons - no more

Edit: Due to a suggestion, we're not going to be using Dubloons, We add money to your account daily, and you can cash out at any time!

Helping the Environment

credits to BBC for this image

credits to Metalicotransfer.com for this image

Did you know 70% of toxic waste comes from electronic waste, some of it completely working? Electronic waste is a huge problem for our environment. The US exports tons of electronic waste each year to developing countries, and locals burn this waste to extract precious metals from it. This can not be healthy for our atmosphere or the locals. PirateBase wants to change all of that. Instead of throwing away computers, why not convert them into a PirateBase node? Every day your old gadgets run, you can be earning money by just selling us your unused bandwidth. We hope PirateBase brings on a revolution to eliminate electronic waste, and what's better is that you'll get paid for helping the environment, while powering a safe, secure cloud database. It's a win-win-win!

Timeline

Patent-pending Design

This is what our PUT request looks like. Initiating a put request will be simple with just three parameters, the file, the password, and the account key to be used for billing, and our servers will respond with your file key so you can access the data.

Behind the scenes: The client tells our server the file size and SHA hash, and our server gives them a list of addresses to send to. The client then splits the file up into packets, and for each packet, it attaches a SHA hash to the packet before it for confirmation of correct delivery. The client then uploads each packet to separate nodes and those nodes will replicate and check for correctness. If anything goes wrong, our server and client will be notified, and the unsuccessful packets will be sent to different addresses. The client after successful delivery, then saves an SHA hash for authenticity. If a node goes offline, then another node downloads that file and hosts it. Our active database will always contain enough copies of your file so that it is always available.

This is what our GET request looks like for lowly requested files. Initiating a get request consists of just 3 parameters, the file key, the password, and the account key to be used for billing. Our server will initiate our nodes to start transferring your files.

Behind the scenes: Our server receives the request, checks it, and picks one of the groups of nodes that contain the file packets. The server sends the request to the first node, and the node then notifies the next node and starts transferring the file to the client. The next node does the same. When the client gets all the packets, it assembles the packets into files and checks for authenticity with the SHA hash.

Multicast: Once your file gets to a certain rate of requests, another node then hosts the whole file and initiates a single source multicast. Clients then just needs the address of the multicast for download. When in multicast mode, you're billed by how long the file stays in multicast, not by the bandwidth. So you would be paying a fixed rate instead of paying other cloud companies for total throughput.


All files are chopped into minuscule packet size data chunks and each chunk in a file is stored in different nodes so the whole cluster is more reliable because there is no single node of failure for each file and recovery is quick for each file if a node containing data from it goes down. We also have a protection mechanism to recover lost data in worst case scenarios when all nodes go down at the exact same time for a piece of data in a file. We firmly believe that this design will handle even the most unreliable of clusters.

Why do we need money?

Developing this software will require our complete attention and time. The money will go towards all the expenses of further developing and deploying PirateBase, including the hardware and maintenance costs. 

Can't donate, but want to help?

Please thndr our video, and share it on your social media websites! Every share helps!

We Promise

We promise PirateBase will only be used for good, and it will only be used to protect your privacy and offer a better alternative to cloud storage services to software developers. We promise that no matter what happens, you can trust PirateBase to store and transfer your information securely. We promise PirateBase will not sell your information and data to the NSA. PirateBase is our passion and we believe it can change the world.

FAQ:

Q: "What exactly does it do again"?

A: Think of using your node as a torrent seed, except each file is replicated by our servers standards, and we have more efficient and scalable methods of data transfers. Basically rent out your old electronics as a miniservers to developers and cloud storage users. For developers, if you think our datastore will be unreliable see below. It will actually be MORE powerful because of our design emphasizing reliability even with unreliable and varying nodes.

Q: "A datastore made of a cluster of unreliable, wildly varying performance hardware? This can't possibly go wrong."

A: The great thing about our database is that we EXPECT that each node is very unreliable and have varying performance , so we designed our software to be reliable even with unreliable nodes! With a high level sharding, and the fact that each node CAN'T contain more than one packet size data chunk from each file, if they do go offline, our other nodes containing that same packet will replicate it. Only if all of the nodes go down at the same time BEFORE one of the nodes containing that packet gets a chance to replicate the packet then will that packet become unavailable. And we can even deal with that with our Self Protecting Packet Recovery System in which we store the parity bit of the horizontal bit position of a segment of packets so we can recover a lost packet out of a segment of packets. We can also do statistical analysis of each node's reliability and make sure that we replicate it enough that each packet is available a certain percent of the time, in our case 99.99 % which is on par with google and amazon.

We also thought of a great way to deal with wildly varying performance hardware of each node. In the most basic sense, it self learns for each node based on the rate of requests it can handle, and each node has a queue of requests to handle. When the queue gets larger, the node exchanges  a highly requested packet with another node with a decreasing queue of packets with lowly requested packet.

Q: I like your idea but I do not understand some things. How do you protect stored data on people's devices, and how are you going to use that device as cloud if it is offline most of the time? Or it has to be online all the time to actually make money? Or do you just store the device in your data-center?

A: Read above on unreliable and varying performance hardware. You get paid depending on how long you're online.

We don't necessarily "protect" the data in any sense: we can't fully control the nodes hardware, but we shard(which means split up into very small pieces) and no node gets more than 1 shard per file. We then encrypt these shards and then duplicate them across several machines.

The software only works when you're connected to the internet. Whenever a device goes offline, we reduplicate from other devices holding those shards that the device was holding onto other active devices. The point is, is that instead of throwing your old electronics away, you can keep them in your house and have them run all the time connected to your devices.

We take all this into account in the calculations section and estimate it with a Efficiency Coefficient.

Q: "Do devices need to have 1TB or more of hard drive space?"

A: No, Old devices need not necessarily contain 1 TB, they can have any storage amount they want, and the pay is distributed correspondingly. You get paid on how many packet size shards you store so even if you had a few kilobytes of free space, you can get paid for it (even though it won't be much).

Q: "Wouldn't data have to be encrypted? Wouldn't that slow everything down severely, especially considering the nodes are old hardware?"

A: No, its not encrypted on the node side. The nodes basically only have a few functions, which is to respond to requests, to forward requests, and to check for authenticity, so its relatively easy on the hardware side. The data is encrypted in a layer on the client side, so yes, uploading would take longer than usual, but its good for security that all data is encrypted anyways.

Q:

Without knowing the first thing about cloud storage or data handling here are my comments ...

  • I find your monthly payouts to be wildly optimistic because they assume 100% utilization of an individuals available resources (unless you intend to pay people for availability)
  • Most personal internet service agreements explicitly prohibit this kind of thing (I could be wrong, but I doubt it)
  • You will pay people in your own crypto-currency?? You mean you will clone bitcoin and call them dubloons? People are pretty skeptical of bitcoin, why should anyone want your dubloons? Give people something real instead. If they provide you with one TB on their system, give them 10 - 100 GB of cloud storage based on their connection speed and uptime availability.

A: 

No, they don't assume 100% utilization. They assume 50% utilization which is a conservative estimate. We do pay bonuses to very reliable nodes.

ISP's do prohibit this kind of thing, but we bypass the ISP by using SSH so the ISP cannot tell what the packet is from.

Edit: We will have a pay as you go, where you will be able to set budgets for each day! Thanks for the suggestion!

Q: I was more concerned about security. As far as I can tell anyone who is running a node can scrape your database.

A:

No, the server stores the data randomly on each node, and each node cannot contain more than 1 packet size data chunk from each file, and each file is encrypted, and checked for authenticity on delivery. Our servers chooses the data that each node contains, and the file key is different from the file key, so the data will be completely random and there's no meaningful data that the node can read.

So we've gotten a lot of feedback that the video and a lot of this information is confusing. If it is please use the quick summary! We'll make a better and easier video to understand soon!FAQ At Bottom! Seriously, if you're skeptical, read it! We really thought everything through. Ask us anything!EDIT FROM VIDEO: We will not be using Dubloons, we will add money to your account daily based on total bandwidth used, average daily GB stored for a month and a reliability and availability coefficient. Thanks for the suggestion!QUICK SUMMARY FOR YOU TL;DRsAlmost all technology companies need bandwidth and servers. They need the servers to do computing and store data, and the bandwidth to bring that data to you. For example, Facebook uses servers to store your photos and videos, and uses the bandwidth to send those photos and videos to your computer. Piratebase makes use of your wasted computing power (old electronics) and wasted bandwidth to power our very own cloud database. It's very much like converting your computer into a torrent seeder, but it's more secure, efficient, and makes you money! That means Facebook could instead of buying servers, use thousands of your computers to power itself. You get free money for no work, software developers get access to cheap(est), reliable, and powerful cloud services  and hopefully PirateBase will convince people to keep their electronics or repair them so they can make money off of them!So first things first, how much can you make?Well lets do some calculations!Let's say X is the number of hours you don't use the internet per day.Let's say Y is the number of gigabytes of hard drive you haven't used.Lets say Z is your internet upload speed in mbps.These are very conservative estimates.If you got paid .06 cents for every Gigabyte our software uploaded for you (half the price of Google Cloud Storage),and you got paid $.01 a month for every Gigabyte of files from our clients stored in your drives (matches the cheapest storage provider).You would get paid around ((Z/8000) * 60 * 60 * 30 * X * .06)(.50) (efficiency coefficient - conservative estimate) + (Y * .01) * Z/24 per month!So if you didn't want to do any math, assuming you have 5 mbps upload speed and 1 TB of free hard drive space, and spent 1 hours using the internet uploading things (most people download when they're browsing the internet).You would earn $47 each month from uploading, and $10 each month from storing files in your extra storage space! All for downloading some software!Now let's say you had 20 mbps upload speed, you would earn$187 a month from uploading!Your best situation would be if you had a many machines machine connected to your internet for a total of 16 GB RAM and 1 gbps internet speed (this is for you google fiberians!). You would earn a whopping $9350That's right. Close to 10 grand for making use of your unused bandwidth! And remember, this is all while powering the the most affordable cloud service, while putting in no effort!Don't you think that PirateBase might drive up demand for faster internet? That's awesome because everyone hates slow internet.These numbers may not be completely accurate (but they are really conservative) due to down times in your ISP's, down times in our system, and not enough demand for PirateBase :(.Now, If you're interested read on!The Internet is the single largest and most important development in human history, past, present, and future, but large internet corporations and the government are taking away your rights and privacy. PirateBase wants to give the power of the Internet to the users. Software developers, this is the solution you've been waiting for: a cheap, scalable, and simple key-file datastore solution so you can concentrate on what you do best, making great web software.Who are we?We are creative, talented programmers located in Dallas with a passion for networks. We are trying to raise funds to fully devote our time to building the world's first decentralized key-file cloud database for software developers.What is it?For DevelopersPirateBase is a decentralized, patent-pending, secure key-file database with a simple API. It will be much cheaper than cloud storage options on the market right now especially for highly requested files, and will offer low latency, 99.99% availability, and unlimited throughput. Developers need not worry about their data being lost because the data will be securely replicated on multiple machines across the US (and other countries later on). It will offer the scalability of large databases managed by Google, Facebook and other tech giants without any initial capital cost. Secure encryption will ensure that not even PirateBase will have access to the information stored in the database.Cloud storage and networking specialists, wanna help? Contact us on the FAQ, we would love to hear your input and expertise.For Gamers and Techies and Computer UsersRent out your unused computer storage and bandwidth for our crypto-currency, in which you can then sell for cash! All you have to do is install our software, and watch your account balance grow! PirateBase will have the lowest bandwidth and processor priority, so it won't interfere with your work or play. You can use PirateBase to store your files. Our services are fast, secure, reliable, and most of all affordable. PirateBase Dubloons - no moreEdit: Due to a suggestion, we're not going to be using Dubloons, We add money to your account daily, and you can cash out at any time!Helping the Environmentcredits to BBC for this imagecredits to Metalicotransfer.com for this imageDid you know 70% of toxic waste comes from electronic waste, some of it completely working? Electronic waste is a huge problem for our environment. The US exports tons of electronic waste each year to developing countries, and locals burn this waste to extract precious metals from it. This can not be healthy for our atmosphere or the locals. PirateBase wants to change all of that. Instead of throwing away computers, why not convert them into a PirateBase node? Every day your old gadgets run, you can be earning money by just selling us your unused bandwidth. We hope PirateBase brings on a revolution to eliminate electronic waste, and what's better is that you'll get paid for helping the environment, while powering a safe, secure cloud database. It's a win-win-win!TimelinePatent-pending DesignThis is what our PUT request looks like. Initiating a put request will be simple with just three parameters, the file, the password, and the account key to be used for billing, and our servers will respond with your file key so you can access the data.Behind the scenes: The client tells our server the file size and SHA hash, and our server gives them a list of addresses to send to. The client then splits the file up into packets, and for each packet, it attaches a SHA hash to the packet before it for confirmation of correct delivery. The client then uploads each packet to separate nodes and those nodes will replicate and check for correctness. If anything goes wrong, our server and client will be notified, and the unsuccessful packets will be sent to different addresses. The client after successful delivery, then saves an SHA hash for authenticity. If a node goes offline, then another node downloads that file and hosts it. Our active database will always contain enough copies of your file so that it is always available.This is what our GET request looks like for lowly requested files. Initiating a get request consists of just 3 parameters, the file key, the password, and the account key to be used for billing. Our server will initiate our nodes to start transferring your files.Behind the scenes: Our server receives the request, checks it, and picks one of the groups of nodes that contain the file packets. The server sends the request to the first node, and the node then notifies the next node and starts transferring the file to the client. The next node does the same. When the client gets all the packets, it assembles the packets into files and checks for authenticity with the SHA hash.Multicast: Once your file gets to a certain rate of requests, another node then hosts the whole file and initiates a single source multicast. Clients then just needs the address of the multicast for download. When in multicast mode, you're billed by how long the file stays in multicast, not by the bandwidth. So you would be paying a fixed rate instead of paying other cloud companies for total throughput.All files are chopped into minuscule packet size data chunks and each chunk in a file is stored in different nodes so the whole cluster is more reliable because there is no single node of failure for each file and recovery is quick for each file if a node containing data from it goes down. We also have a protection mechanism to recover lost data in worst case scenarios when all nodes go down at the exact same time for a piece of data in a file. We firmly believe that this design will handle even the most unreliable of clusters.Why do we need money?Developing this software will require our complete attention and time. The money will go towards all the expenses of further developing and deploying PirateBase, including the hardware and maintenance costs. Can't donate, but want to help?Please thndr our video, and share it on your social media websites! Every share helps!We PromiseWe promise PirateBase will only be used for good, and it will only be used to protect your privacy and offer a better alternative to cloud storage services to software developers. We promise that no matter what happens, you can trust PirateBase to store and transfer your information securely. We promise PirateBase will not sell your information and data to the NSA. And we can even deal with that with our Self Protecting Packet Recovery System in which we store the parity bit of the horizontal bit position of a segment of packets so we can recover a lost packet out of a segment of packets. story:
*This is the extension of our $74,993 Indiegogo campaign and $76,561 Kickstarter campaign*



Never Lose Your Things Again!

Plan On Getting Wet?

3 Signs Bringrr Is Perfect For You

1. You turn around mid-trip because you forget your things.


2. You always misplace your keys.


3. You worry about your pet running away.

3 Ways Bringrr Can Solve Your Problems. 


1. Bringrr will always notify you that your most important items are in the car before you drive away.



2. BringTags turn anything (including your keys) into Bluetooth beacons, so you can easily find misplaced items.

.


3. The Bringrr App will notify you if your missing item (or pet) is found by the Bringrr community.

So Bringrr Is More Than Just A Car Charger? How Does It Work?

Yep. Simply pair your phone with Bringrr via bluetooth, and it will make sure you never drive off without your phone again. Every time you start your car, Bringrr will search for your phone. If your phone's not there, Bringrr notifies you with a friendly flash and sound.

What If I Want To Make Sure The Rest Of My Stuff Is With Me Before I Drive Away?

Good question! This is where BringTags come in. You can attach BringTags to the items you want to keep track of, and worry less. As soon as you start your car, Bringrr searches for your phone and tagged items, like your wallet, backpack, laptop - you name it! If anything is missing, Bringrr will let you know. You will receive a notification on your phone, specifying which tagged item you've left behind.

Can I Schedule Bringrr To Look For My Tagged Items Only On Certain Days?

Definitely. You can use the Bringrr App to create a schedule for your tagged items. Bringrr will search for them only on the days and times you specify. 

If you travel frequently, schedule the app ahead of time so you don't leave any crucial items behind. Because you can't turn around for your things once you're on a plane!

Can I Use My Current Calendar App With Bringrr?

You can! Bringrr works with Apple Calendar and Google Calendar. Once you’ve tagged your items and created item profiles on the Bringrr App, you can use the Notes section (Apple Calendar) or Description section (Google Calendar) to tell Bringrr what you need for that specific event. Simply type the word “Bringrr:” followed by the names of the items you don’t want to forget. The Bringrr App syncs with your calendar, and Bringrr will remind you to bring your tagged items. It’s that easy!

• iOS Users: You can set up Bringrr reminders by using the Calendar app on your Mac, iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch or even at iCloud.com.

• Android Users: You can set up Bringrr reminders by using Google Calendar on any Android device or even at Google.com/Calendar. 

As long as Apple or Google Calendar syncs to your smartphone, you will never drive away without your important things again.

What Else Can BringTags Do?

Outside of the car, BringTags help you find your misplaced items. You can use the Bringrr App to track down your tagged item by distance, within a 50-150ft range. The App will guide you toward the item's location. If you still can't find your item, just activate the BringTag's built-in speaker to find it by sound.

Ok, But What If I Still Can't Find My Misplaced Item?

Chances are, it's lost. The good news is you are not alone! Just mark the item as 'missing' on the App. This will silently and discreetly put the entire Bringrr community on the lookout for your tagged item. When anyone with a Bringrr gets within range of your lost item, you will get a notification of its location; securely and anonymously. Your location is never shared with anyone else. Maintaining your privacy is very important to us.

Wow, That's A Lot Of Distance Covered! Tell Me More.

  • Bringrr charges any USB device
  • BringTags can be shared with the people in your life
  • BringTags last a year and never need to be charged
  • BringTags have an interchangeable battery
  • BringTags use Bluetooth LE so your smartphone won't suffer from battery loss
  • BringTags have a built-in accelerometer
  • You can log in the Bringrr App from anyone's smartphone to find your misplaced tagged items
  • The App saves the last GPS location of your tagged items so you can easily find them later
  • The App updates Bringrr so you get all the latest features

I'm A Developer. Is Bringrr Open Source?

Yes, you will be able to integrate Bringrr and BringTags any way you see fit on any app you want to develop. You will be able to sign up as a developer on our website and get access to the Bringrr API. Feel free to contact us if you have any questions.

How Does Bringrr Work With Google Glass?

Seamlessly. With Google Glass, all of Bringrr's features come alive in front of your eyes.

  • If Bringrr notices that you’ve left something behind, Glass will tell you what forgot to bring.


  • Assigning BringTags with Glass is easy. Just specify your item and the tag you want to use, and Glass takes a picture. 


  • If you misplace something, just ask Glass. You will be taken right to your item.


  • If a lost item you’ve marked as missing is found by the Bringrr community, Glass will guide you to the item's location.

If You Liked It, Then You Should've Put a BringTag On It!

BringTags make the perfect addition to a thoughtful gift that is too valuable or sentimental to lose.

What's The Story Behind Bringrr?

We'd love to share it with you! It all started with our CEO's uncanny ability to forget his phone everywhere. And when we say everywhere, we mean everywhere; home, office, bar, park bench, you name it. For most of us, our smartphone is a crucial tool that we can't go without. So if you ever leave your phone behind, you're most likely not going to go about your day without it, you will drive back and get it. We wanted to solve this problem. When conceiving the idea of Bringrr, we wondered what kind of devices were already available that could prevent us from turning around mid-trip to get our phones. After searching for a product that could possibly do this, we found only devices that leashed the phone to you, which could result in a lot of false alarms. That’s not the problem we wanted to solve. We wanted a device that could be left in the car and practically forgotten until it was needed. So we thought of things that are always in your car, and the first device that came to mind was a car charger. Light bulbs went off in our heads! It’s stationary, everyone needs one and it’s out of the way. Why should your car charger just charge your phone and do nothing else, is the question we asked ourselves. With that in mind, we got to work. Shortly after, Bringrr was born.

Aldo (CEO) looking pensive during one of our brainstorming sessions.

We then went a step further and asked ourselves, what about remembering to bring everything else? During our first brainstorming session, the answer almost came instantaneously; bluetooth beacons! The name “BringTags” was conceived even faster. We wanted BringTags to easily attach to things so Bringrr could search for them in addition to our phones. Our team didn’t stop there. We wanted to add other features to the tags that made them usable outside of the car. The problem of forgetting goes hand in hand with misplacing your things. So making BringTags able to find your misplaced or lost items was just the natural evolution of the Bringrr system. Adding a speaker to BringTags so we could find our misplaced items by sound, on top of using the Bringrr App to find items by distance, was our way of creating a complete system. We were very excited to tackle the challenge of making the age-old problem of driving away without your things, a problem of the past. This motivated us to act quickly and begin the design process to make Bringrr and BringTags a reality. After months of planning and engineering, we had the first prototypes.

Testing the original Bringrr prototype.

Check out our Slideshare.

How Was Bringrr Engineered?

Very carefully. The basic engineering concept behind Bringrr is simple.

Bringrr block diagram.

We currently have a fully functioning prototype of Bringrr that works as shown. This was completely developed by our team from scratch, without using any off-the-shelf products. For the BringTags, we used the TI SensorTag development platform as a base to create the prototype. Since then, we have designed our own circuitry and developed the firmware, so BringTags communicate with Bringrr. The prototypes currently work with our early stage app. We have a functioning version of the Bringrr App for iOS that allows us to test our prototypes and make sure they work correctly. The Bringrr App(s) for Android and Google Glass are currently in the preliminary stages of development.

Here is everything we have developed so far:

Bringrr

• Power circuit board developed

BringTags

• Bluetooth circuit board developed

Enclosures

• Original enclosure for Bringrr

• Final enclosure for Bringrr & BringTags

How Will My Contribution Help?

The cost of manufacturing Bringrrs and BringTags becomes much less expensive when we meet volume order requirements for the components and devices. We have fully functional prototypes that we’ve carefully refined, and we’re nearly ready to begin manufacturing. This means all we need is to have a certain number of Bringrrs and BringTags spoken for before we can begin the process of manufacturing. 

Our manufacturing partner Poly-Products Industries is based in Hong Kong, and is able to produce all of our components in house. With over 30 years of experience manufacturing for Fortune 500 companies, they are proficient at producing high volume orders quickly, so they will be able to make as many units as we need.

We can't wait to see where this amazing journey takes us.

All thanks to you!

- The Bringrr Team
